What was great: You are a great company!!
Everything I ordered came quickly.

What could we improve: My last catalog did not have an envelope.  I spent a lot of time looking for your address to send a check for my last order.  I hope I sent it to the right address.

What Issues: My order has incorrect items and/or missing items;
What could we improve: Include everything the first time. Also, the students were disappointed in some of the items (the backpack and journal keychains) because of misleading advertising. You also took away the option for a teacher to input student orders which took SO much extra time. I will not be ordering from scholastic ever again.

What was great: Fast service and wonderful product.
Additional Comments: Perfect experience.

What could we improve: nothing

What was great: Multiple titles, prices were reasonable.  Explanation for how to link my teacher account to my parent account.
The ease of your website.
Ease of ordering and speed of delivery.
Fast service; order was accurate.  Also the ordering process is easy on your website.
Additional Comments: Great job!

What could we improve: I don't like that a due date is created for us as it doesn't align with how we send out book orders. Not being able to change it makes it confusing.

Additional Comments: I would like to see more of the $1 books return.  I buy a monthly book for each of my students and I think this is going to be ending sadly because I just can't afford it any longer.

What could we improve: This is new to me, but I worry that I will forget to submit an order for a family since it has to go through me.  There may be a safeguard for this issue that I don't know about.

What was great: The site is very easy to navigate, and the process was efficient from beginning to end.
The order shipped quickly and was accurate.
Additional Comments: I still would like to be able to add student orders manually. Some kids are from homes where the parents will let them bring cash for a book but they won't scan the QR code to pay online. These kids will be excluded. I do love the option of the QR code so parents don't need a code.

What was great: The ease of ordering, the quickness that I received my items, and the communication updating me at each step.
It was easy to contact staff with any questions, but the process was simple from the shopping part to the ordering part.

What could we improve: I know it's hard with prices rising but teachers really relied on the $1 books please bring them back.
Additional Comments: Please bring back $1 books or at least the $1 store after ordering so much like last year

What Issues: My order has incorrect items and/or missing items;
What could we improve: one item was missing 43Y1
Additional Comments: still need item 43Y1

What Issues: I have not received a package;
What could we improve: It is so hard to find the lower cost books to buy for a classroom . I shouldn’t have to jump through hoops .

What Issues: My items are damaged;
What could we improve: One of the books had extra ink smeared across the cover probably from printing, shouldn't have made it into the box (the book was part of my free $10 to spend)

What was great: I recently spoke on the phone with a rep and she was so lovely and knowledgeable. She was able to answer all my questions and help me customize my order to exactly what I needed.
user friendly

What could we improve: The charged taxes for student orders and no cash orders are difficult for our demographics. Wish I would of know of changes ahead of time.

What was great: My families love that they can order books for their children that are age appropriate and reasonably priced. I in turn receive bonus points which enable me to increase our classroom library.
My order was correct and arrived in a timely fashion.

What could we improve: I find it a bit confusing and challenging when trying to add books with the spend right now because I earned some bonus.

What was great: Fast Delivery with notification of box whereabouts

What Issues: No name was included.
What could we improve: The name of the student who ordered was not included in the box or on the order form.

What was great: I used points to get more chair pockets  for my class. Ordering was easy and delivery was timely.

What could we improve: everything was fine

What was great: The title choices and the quick delivery

What could we improve: The items ordered were from bonus points and they were a little difficult to find on the site.

Additional Comments: If I'm placing a $300 order, I would have liked access to the $1 books!

What could we improve: I believe that I have earned the dollar amount necessary to have been awarded the $10 to spend in that order. The website is not user friendly toconfirm/use these rewards.
The interface could be more user-friendly. It is challenging finding the teacher order form.

Website is very easy to use.  Books were delivered on time.
I loved the selection of books and the ease of ordering.

What could we improve: Include a self-addressed envelope again. I have parents who do not want to pay online.

received the ordered books in a quick manner!

Because they were unable to completely understand, I choose to pay the shipping fees associated with their item. I could of told them no but because I want to encourage reading, I took it upon myself to pay.

Books delivered before expected and in great shape .all books ordered were included.

What could we improve: I would REALLY have liked the book order forms before the first day of school.

What was great: quick and accurate delivery

What was great: The books arrived quickly, which made my students super happy!

What could we improve: Bring back the $1 books. The price increase makes it difficult for educators in low income schools to get books into their students hands

What was great: Prices and the speedy delivery of the books.

What could we improve: The book prices have gotten way more expensive!
Additional Comments: Bring back the $1 book store please!

What was great: quick and easy to order
Additional Comments: You used to offer more books at a better price, but lately I am finding books on different sites for cheaper. One example is "The Outsiders."  The prices also keep changing month to month (ex: Bud, not Buddy was one price in July/August, and then once the school year started, it jumped up $2/book from $4-$6).  These are some little things I have noticed.

What was great: Getting the books in time

What could we improve: I received an email telling me my box had been delivered on a Friday but didn’t receive until Monday
See the flyer online

Additional Comments: I’m not a fan of strictly online ordering. I know most families choose to order online, but there are some who do not have internet access. I also don’t like that they cannot find my class by class code now.

What was great: Easy ordering and quick service
Fast order
Additional Comments: I am hoping that there will be more $1.50/$2 books, or the 5 for $5/ 10 for $10 value packs. I've done campaigns to be able to send home books with students, but want to make sure I can choose appropriate books for my students.

What was great: Ordering for students and delivery

What could we improve: Having $1 or $1.50 books of the week.
Additional Comments: Please bring back the books of the week deals

What could we improve: Quicker delivery
Wait until September to start  for orders parents just have bought school clothes and school supplies for their children. Maybe that way we could more students to order.
I'm disappointed with the overall change in the format as well as price increase.
Additional Comments: After 20+ years of supporting Scholastic,  I believe that has come to an end. It is no longer something I can tell my parents that has a great selection with great prices.

What was great: Quick turnaround time from order to delivery.
Additional Comments: The teacher dollar book sets (10 for $10) are sadly missed and impossible to locate if they DO still exist. We teachers live for these deals for geting gift books for the class.

What was great: The selection, easy to navigate and speedy delivery
Ease of ordering and fast shipping!!
Additional Comments: All great thank you!!

What could we improve: Bring back the $1.00 and $1.50 books. I have friends and family who are donating money so I can buy each of my students a book every month and now that your prices have gone up it’s going to make this very difficult. You also reduced the number of bonus points that you get with your first order of $300. You used to give 10,000 bonus points and now all you can get is 1000. That is a huge difference. Teachers spend so much of their own money to purchase things for their classroom. I felt like Scholastic was an affordable way to provide books for my students, but with your price increase, it’s no longer feasible to purchase books for my 25 students every month.

What was great: Easy ordering and quick delivery
Additional Comments: Would like to still be able to add individual student orders. Not all parents are tech savvy.

What was great: Easy to order and quick to receive
Additional Comments: One thing is to make sure the teacher's name is on the box. Mine was not and my district had to open it to see where it belonged.

What could we improve: Go back to the previous flyers.

What was great: Quick service
ease of ordering, wait and delivery time

What could we improve: It was all good.

What Issues: My items are damaged;

What could we improve: The prices of books have really risen and I know that is true for everything. But I had hoped to sponsor a class in a Title 1 building as well as my own and I just can't afford to do it.

What Issues: Again, I had to pay taxes!

What was great: Fast delivery a a
The order was correct and received in a timely manner.

Crystal Pearon was SO helpful! She gave me credit on my previous order because I forgot to put in the discount code, and she did everything she could to help make the ordering process smooth, easy and efficient.  We got disconnected and she called right back (I was teaching so I couldn't answer), but she emailed me, and when I called back, she was happy to help me.  She was so kind and accommodating, and I appreciate her help so much!  Everything was handled professionally and with fantastic customer service!  I appreciate the whole experience!
Easy ordering experience and fast delivery
quick and easy delivery and ordering

What could we improve: I do not like the fact that my students can’t bring money to me to make an order. This is not friendly for my community Most of families want to pay cash, not online!

What was great: books arrived in a timely manner

What could we improve: Either filled the box with bubbles/paper or send in a shorter box. Box was crushed in one corner so one of the book corners was bent.

I live in an area where many parents don't have access to the internet. So I was shocked when I went to place a student order and had to just put it as mine and then pay for the tax. It was also really difficult to find the nonbook things that I was looking for this time.
Additional Comments: I've seen lots of chatter in Facebook groups about how horrible their last Scholastic experiences have been as well. Lots of complaints about the price increase as well as parents being required to order online now.

What was great: Ease of ordering and quick delivery!
The order arrived much faster than anticipated.

What could we improve: I'm disappointed that the class set value packs are no longer available.  I was hoping to get a "book a month" for my students, but with the cheapest books being $2/book, I won't be able to do this on the donations I got.  Customer service said you are going to only 6 campaigns, but that still puts less books in the hands of kids.

The box was a bit too big and therefore many of the items shifted.  One corner of the box was smashed and inside one of the student's Adopt a Fox Box was smashed.  ?? Next time send in a smaller box to avoid "dead space" so things don't get tossed around so easily.

What was great: The books arrived quickly and undamaged.
Additional Comments: This class set of books was great. However, we do have some concerns about the book selections that have been on the recent flyers. The books students have to choose from are not to their liking or interest, so they have not been wanting to order. From a student's perspective, there aren't many books on there that are interesting. From a teacher's perspective, books such as Pokemon, Anime, Piggy, Nightmare King, House of Shivers, Dragonball, are lacking in substance and content, and quit frankly, pretty dark. We're hoping to see more fun, light-hearted and inspiring selections that will motivate students and enrich their love for reading and to aim higher in life than video games and ghost stories.

What could we improve: I was on the phone with accounting and billing and told that they were moving $100 out of an account that I wasn't using anymore and would put in in my current account.  Then, they said they would close the account.  They told me to go ahead and place my order and in a couple days $100 would be showing in my account.  So, I placed the order for $128 and the money wasn't moved and my old account was closed.  I have the $28 for the order, but do not have the $100 since it wasn't moved into my account and now there is no record of that account.  VERY DISAPPOINTED.
Additional Comments: I hope that the $100 credit will be added to my current account or I will not be placing another order with Scholastic.

I ordered due to previous delays to guarantee that the box would arrive on time.  It seems as though your shipping issue have been delayed.  Side note:  it would’ve been nice to know BEFORE I started my book campaign that you changed the dollar book to a $2 book.  When you design a campaign based on half of what you need it’s rather inconvenient and further disheartening to feel you’ve met your goal only to find you are half way there.

easy ordering
fast and easy

What Issues: See previous comment.
What could we improve: I had previously ordered the magnetic notebook and it was about 2’x3’. I ordered it this time, without making sure to look at the measurements. Shame on me. 8 1/2”x 11” was not what I needed.

What was great: Ease of ordering

Additional Comments: I’m very disappointed with the recent changes Scholastic has made. Now that all parent orders need to be placed online, I foresee very few orders being placed. My students need to take home the flyer and see what they can buy. I also purchase many books for my students and classroom. With the ending of dollar books and book packs that contain the SAME book, I am no longer able to rely on Scholastic to help build my classroom library and my student’s libraries. Sadly after 22 years, I think this will be the last year I use Scholastic.

What was great: Delivery time
Speedy delivery! Correct items! Well done!

What was great: It was really fast delivery, no damage

What was great: Fast
Quick service

What could we improve: more book selections

Ordering is pretty simple, however, I'm rather confused about when I have earned $ to spend as a teacher when students place orders.  It seems that I'm always asked to add my own credit/debit card.  Is there something I'm missing?  Do I NEED to add my own card but then it's not charged when I "submit" the order?  Any help would be appreciated!
Additional Comments: See prior comments regarding $ for my teacher order. Thank you!

What could we improve: Honestly I am just heart broken to know that you took away services to teachers that help us out. I like to encourage building libraries at home for my students. I am a teacher... teaching at a poverty level school... so we do not have funds available to us either. I try the scholastic campaigns but no on will donate bc I only know people who are struggling as well. I use to buy a book a month for my students, so the $1 books, the book of the week, and the value packs that make a classroom set 10 for $10 made it affordable. Now you no longer offer these deals. The book of the month for $2 I guess would be the next thing I could go for but there is not options to ensure a good book for my grade level. So does this mean I need to start looking else where for the books I buy monthly for my students? I really hate that Scholastic is closing these chances to help teachers try and give the magic of reading to their students.
Additional Comments: BRING BACK Book of the week or the 10 for $10 packs.

What was great: Scholastic is ALWAYS great!
Additional Comments: none at this time

What could we improve: I am sad to see your dollar book deals go away! For those of us who are buying for whole classes because all kids deserve a chance at literacy, it’s really disheartening. If you were going to completely cut the dollar books, I wish there would have been done gradually so we could save points knowing that the price would double. Despite my discouragement about price the book box arrived quickly and the order was correct.
Additional Comments: Bring back the dollar books… I know many teachers and this has been an upsetting realization to many of us who frequently use our own money to buy books for students. Even those who try to get sponsors to help defray costs are less likely to get sponsors at double the price.

What could we improve: The book selection from the Scholastic Dollars catalog is unimpressive.  It's always been limited selection, but it felt even more so when I placed my last order.  And the shipping costs are unreasonably high.
Additional Comments: I would expect the shipment to be quick, considering the price of shipping.  So no kudos there.  We love Scholastic and have been using you for book fairs for years.  The Scholastic Dollars Catalog needs much improvement.  Thank you for letting us provide feedback.

What could we improve: I feel a little blind sided by scholastic. This summer scholastic promoted campaigns to raise money- I raised enough for my students to each get ten $2 books this school year. It was beyond frustrating when scholastic opened for the school year to see that there is only one two dollar book offered. In the future I will not do campaigns. It was misleading and I am disapointed.

What was great: Quick and Easy! Wish there was free shipping on the bonus point books for each month.
